intro: Gnidia anomala, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a serrated margin. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and are usually white or pale yellow in color.
